intro: Microula longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed microula, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Microula longipes is often found in rocky outcrops and along coastal dunes, showcasing its resilience to extreme conditions.
